bottom card of the draw pile
tasting (a nobleman's) medicine to see if it contains poison, medicine taster
once, before, formerly, ever, former, ex-
never yet, never before, first time, still not happened
to lick, to lap, to suck
to taste
to experience (esp. a hardship)
to look down on (someone), to make fun of, to put down, to treat with contempt, to underestimate

to lick something up, to lap something up
going through thick and thin to attain one's objective, enduring unspeakable hardships for the sake of vengeance
sweeping over (e.g. of a natural disaster), engulfing
sweeping victory, clean sweep
offering of the year's new rice harvest (imperial festival, October 17)

not until now, never yet
to lick all over, to run one's tongue over
banquet on the occasion of the first ceremonial offering of rice by the newly-enthroned emperor
to have a bitter experience
shamelessly flattering, brown-nosing, licking excrement
unprecedented, never seen before
to lick (all) up, to lick all over, to lick clean
to engulf (in flames), to consume (of fire), to sweep through, to completely destroy
ceremonial offering to the deities by the Emperor of newly-harvested rice
flavoured miso, miso mixed with meat, vegetables, fish, etc.
akaname, Japanese creature said to lick filth in bathrooms
to look down on (someone), to make fun of, to put down, to treat with contempt, to underestimate
to drink a bitter cup, to have a bitter experience, to suffer a defeat

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓は↑長↑↓なが↓い↑間↑↓ま↓↑臥薪嘗胆↑↓がしんしょうたん↓の↑苦↑↓くる↓しみをなめた。
sdata.e: I have struggled under extreme difficulties for a long time.
